# Advance Contract Award Notice

## Title
The Atlantic Canada Opportunities Agency (ACOA) intends to enter into a contract with Davis Pier Consulting for the study of the growth potential for a world-class industrial bioprocessing ecosystem and bioproduct manufacturing sector in Nova Scotia.

## Description
The purpose of this study is to assess the growth potential for a world-class industrial bioprocessing ecosystem and bioproduct manufacturing sector in Nova Scotia to tap into the global demand for sustainable products and environmentally friendly ingredients. The study will involve researching market demand and trends, infrastructure, expertise, and ecosystem requirements, with the goal of identifying opportunities and challenges for biotechnology startup companies and SMEs.

## Key Activities
The study will consist of three phases:

* Phase 1: Project initiation, which will include conducting a project launch meeting, updating and finalizing the project initiation document, planning the jurisdictional scan, and developing a report outline.
* Phase 2: Current state research, including the preparation and validation of the current state plan, completion of the jurisdictional scan, review of the Nova Scotia context, and engagement with relevant organizations and SMEs.
* Phase 3: Feasibility assessment, which will include conducting a feasibility assessment and opportunities for growth on a five to ten year timeline, identifying attributes needed to sustain growth, and collating the information into a final report and recommendations.

## Minimum Essential Requirements
To be considered for this contract, the supplier must have:

* A minimum of 10 years of experience in project management using a multi-disciplinary team that includes a strong mix of technical, economic, strategy, and consulting skills.
* A minimum of 10 years of experience providing customized reports that provide complex analysis and recommendations to government to inform strategic planning in emerging fields.
* A minimum of 10 years of experience gathering and interpreting data through both targeted primary data collection, as well as secondary-level analysis of existing research and datasets.

## Justification for Pre-identified Supplier
Davis Pier Consulting has a unique combination of knowledge, specialized analytical capacity, and a well-developed network that would be very difficult to duplicate within a reasonable timeframe and for a reasonable cost. The supplier has extensive experience in conducting primary data collection in Nova Scotia and has a strong understanding of the unique policy landscape for an emerging sector.
